item.title: Riot Champion Trend and Item Recommender
item.description: Riot Champion Trends and Item Recommender “is a data science project that aims to visualize a user’s performance by comparing their matches and timeline data against professional or similar ranking players using R and Plotly.” Based on this information, if there is enough correlation between player performance and items to wins, then recommend corresponding items based on matchups. Goals Primary Compile list of professional players from Season 9 of League of Legends Acquire Data from RIOT Servers Build Pipeline for automated collection Conduct data analysis and visualize results – In Progress Determine if secondary objectives are viable Secondary

item.title: Amazon Reviews - Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Leading two fellow students to develop a Python recomendation system for suggesting ratings for a user’s review through collabortive filters and machine learning algorithms achieving our highest accuracy of 89%. This is a multi-classification Goals Acquire Amazon Dataset Exploratory analysis of dataset Use ML Algorithms to predict review ratings Build Jupyter notebook to predict ratings Visualize preprocessed information and compiled Bag Of Words Present findings to general and informed audience Algorithms KNN Naive Bayes Ordered Logistic Regression Linear SVM Doc2Vec Decision Trees Dataset We filtered the initial dataset of over 12 million reviews (12 GB) into five separate csv corresponding to their star ratings using Pandas.

item.title: How In The World
item.description: Mobile game designed for children ages five to nine in an effort to teach youths about cultural literacy while being imformative but also fun. Leading a team of five, we were introduced to the agile methodology as we worked with our client. To develop this came we taught ourselves Lua and Corona SDK over the course of the semester. The game is live and on the itunes app store!
